intro.p: Suppose the triangle \triangle ABC has angles \angle A = {{A}}^{\circ}, side b = {{b}} inches and side c = {{c}} inches.

A note about mathematical convention. For both the Law of Sines and Law of Cosines, mathematicians label each side with a lower case letter that matches the upper case letter of the angle opposite the side, as shown in this example triangle.

content.p: Draw a triangle representing the information above. Label all sides and angles
Find the length of side a. Round your answer to two decimal places.
Find the measurement of \angle B. Round your answer to two decimal places.
Find the measurement of \angle C. Round your answer to two decimal places.
